intro: Rapuntium foliosum, commonly known as the leafy rapunzel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Rapuntium in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming in the summer months. Rapuntium foliosum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
